meanings.sent1: The long hike was bewearying for the young children.
meanings.sent2: After a full day of work, she felt bewearying and just wanted to rest.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending meetings were quite bewearying, but at least they had good snacks.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous task of data entry was as bewearying as watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The heavy backpack felt bewearying on his shoulders as he trudged up the hill.

meanings.definition: Making someone feel tired or exhausted.
meanings.sent1: The bewearying journey left them longing for a comfortable bed.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise outside was bewearying, making it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: His attempts at humor were often more bewearying than amusing to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed bewearying on her shoulders as she struggled to keep up.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending chores were bewearying, but she pushed through to get them done.
